definition: restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: The officials freed under the amnesty have been restored to their posts.
sentences.chinese: 大赦中获释的原官员们已官复原职。

sentences.english: The officials freed under amnesty have been returned to their posts.
sentences.chinese: 大赦中获释的原官员们已官复原职。

sentences.english: The manager was asked to resign but was later restored to his former job.
sentences.chinese: 那位经理被迫辞职，但后来又官复原职了。

sentences.english: So I praised Daniel’s God and so Daniel was back into his important position!
sentences.chinese: 我感谢丹尼尔的上帝，并让丹尼尔官复原职。

sentences.english: Immediately, Norrington was reinstated(9) in the Royal Navy and promoted to admiral.
sentences.chinese: 诺灵顿即刻官复原职，还被晋升为海军上将。

sentences.english: The chief engineer who was forced to resign last week has been restored to his post.
sentences.chinese: 上周被迫辞职的总工程师现已官复原职。

definition: to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
